Body: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 44 sacks of ripe oranges and 25 sacks of unripe oranges per day.
Question: How many more sacks of ripe oranges than unripe oranges are harvested per day?

Body: White t - shirts can be purchased in packages of 53. If mom buys 57 packages of white t - shirts and 34 trousers
Question: How many white t - shirts will she have?

Body: Paul had 2 books. After selling some in a garage sale he bought 150 new ones. If he has 58 books now
Question: How many books did he sell?

Body: 6 storks and 2 birds were sitting on the fence. 3 more birds came to join them.
Question: How many more storks than birds are sitting on the fence?

Body: Bryan took a look at his books and magazines. If he has 27 books and 80 magazines in each of his 23 bookshelves
Question: How many books does he have in total?

Body: Paul got a box of 531 crayons and 38 erasers for his birthday. At the end of the school year he only had 391 left while not having lost a single erasers.
Question: How many more crayons than erasers did he have left?

Body: Lewis earns a total of $ 1216 during the harvest. If he earns $ 16 each week
Question: How many weeks did the harvest last?

Body: Dave had 10 apps on his phone. He added 11 new apps. After deleting some he had 4 left.
Question: How many apps did he delete?

Body: The ring toss game at the carnival made the same amount of money each day. In total in 5 days they earned 165 dollars.
Question: How much did they make per day?

Body: There were 5 roses and 3 orchids in the vase. Jessica cut some more roses and orchids from her flower garden. There are now 12 roses and 2 orchids in the vase.
Question: How many more roses than orchids are there in the vase now?
